metadata.title: Call to embankment at River Indus

content.article_body: MUZAFFARGARH, Mar 06 (APP):The dwellers of Beat Wasa, Kalru and Khanwala (Kot Sultan) have demanded the authorities concerned for embankments to save their farmlands from erosion by Indus river. In this regard, the residents gathered outside the Deputy Commissioner Office They lamented that hundreds of acres of agricultural land had already been lost to erosion from the Indus River, forcing many families to migrate. The protesters pointed out that lawmakers and officials had visited the affected areas multiple times but failed to take practical steps to resolve In response, Deputy Commissioner Quratul Ain stated that a detailed report on the situation had been submitted to the Punjab government, along with an official letter urging immediate action. She expressed the hope that the issue would soon be addressed.
